group_1.narration: I hated my mother.@I hated how strict she was.
People believe that since mothers are related@to us by blood, we mustn't speak ill of them.
Even so, I hate what I hate.

group_1.textLeft: Welcome home, Nayuta. You got your test@back today, correct?

group_1.textRight: Oh yes, I did.
Here. I got a 95.

group_1.textLeft: ...What was the average?

group_1.textRight: Um, it was...75.

group_1.textLeft: So you were only twenty points ahead?

group_1.textRight: B-but I was fifth in my class! That's@a new record for me.

group_1.textLeft: Your placement has been rising and falling,@though, and you've never achieved number one.

group_1.textRight: But the students above me are@really smart...

group_1.textLeft: Are any of their parents scholars?
Then you shouldn't have lost.
Your father is a scholar, so when people@look at you,
they assume that by nature, you should be@the brightest student of them all.
So if you can't get the best grades@in class,
they'll think you're not trying hard,@or that you're not good enough.
Are you trying to embarrass me?@Do you want to tell me this is all my fault?

group_1.textRight: N-no, that's not...

group_1.textLeft: Then whose fault is it?

group_1.textRight: It's mine...

group_1.textLeft: Exactly. You need to do better.
It's almost time for your painting class@to start. Hurry up and get ready.

group_1.textRight: Oh, but I have a piano competition@this weekend.
I want to take a break from painting today.

group_1.textLeft: An excuse like that is never an acceptable@reason to slack off.

group_1.textRight: Papa! Welcome back!

group_1.narration: He was kind, gentle, and@a hard worker. I loved him for it.

group_1.textLeft: You've been gone for ten days!@I'm so glad you're home!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, it's good to be back.@That trip took a lot out of me.

group_1.textCenter: Nayuta, we're in the middle of a conversation...

group_1.textLeft: Huh? What's in this box?

group_1.textRight: Oh yes, that's a souvenir.@A local gave it to me during my stay.
It's a bottle of seasoning based on@the region's soup stock recipe.

group_1.textLeft: It looks delicious! Let's have it with@dinner tonight!
Excuse me?! What are you talking about?
I've put a lot of thought into our menu.
What types of dishes does this go with?

group_1.textRight: The inn used it in their hot pot,@but it's also good with sashimi.
I think it'd go well with just about@everything.

group_1.textLeft: Don't be so glib.
What ingredients are in this to begin with?
You said it's based on the regional stock,@but it doesn't seem like there's any alcohol in it.

group_1.textRight: There's...a little bit of alcohol. But I don't@think it's enough to affect us...

group_1.textLeft: There's no expiration date. How long will@it last once it's opened?

group_1.textRight: They don't have strict guidelines like that...@The locals just judge it by the smell.

group_1.textLeft: You know that's not something I can do.
You really don't think about anything...! You have@no idea how much I'm doing for you and Nayuta!

group_1.textRight: S-sorry...

group_1.textLeft: This demeanor of yours is precisely why@Nayuta doesn't study.
You lack the dignity that one would expect@of a scholarly father.
Thanks to that, Nayuta has lost all respect@for the educated,
and that's why she never studies.

group_1.textRight: I think Nayuta is doing her best.

group_1.textLeft: You're spoiling her again!

group_1.textRight: I-I'll keep doing my best! It's not Papa's fault.
I don't think it's right to be mad at him.

group_1.textLeft: Shut up. This is between me and your father.

group_1.narration: My parents argued constantly. Their fights always@went the same way: my mother blamed everything@on my father, and all he could do was apologize.
I would argue with my mother in order to protect@my father, but she didn't like me doing so.
That, on a day-to-day basis,@was how we lived our lives in that household.
And in the course of those ordinary days,@I ended up destroying my family.
